page.title: 11HEALTH
page.content: A teacher who left to have a baby told us about ante and post natal care. First, she visited her General Practitioner, he confirmed her pregnancy and sent her to the maternity unit at Basildon Hospital. She visited the unit monthly, her urine was tested and her blood pressure checked. At sixteen weeks she had a scan which was exciting because she saw her baby on a screen. She stopped work eleven weeks before her baby was due.Classes were arranged to teach the mothers about caring for their babies and they were shown the labour ward. Both parents were shown films of the birth of a baby.Mothers stay in hospital between 48 hours and seven days. At home a midwife visits for the first three days,a health visitor visits on the fourth. Children continue to have check ups in school.
